title_original: Israel's Netanyahu says many signs that Khamenei 'is no longer'
content_original: JERUSALEM, Feb 28 (Reuters) - Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Saturday that there were many signs suggesting Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei may have been killed in Israeli-U.S. strikes in Iran. "This morning we destroyed the compound of the tyrant Khamenei," Netanyahu said in a video statement, adding that for more than 30 years Khamenei had "dispatched terrorism across the world, made his own people miserable, and worked constantly and tirelessly on a program to annihilate the state of Israel".
title_en: Netanyahu claims signs of Khamenei's death in Israeli-U.S. strikes
summary_en: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that there are indications Ayatollah Ali Khamenei may have been killed in recent strikes by Israel and the US in Iran. Netanyahu mentioned the destruction of Khamenei's compound and accused him of terrorism, oppressing his people, and attempting to destroy Israel. This development, if confirmed, could have significant implications for Iran's leadership and the ongoing conflict.

classification.brief: The potential killing of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in US-Israeli strikes on Iran could lead to significant leadership upheaval and escalation in the conflict.

title_original: Analysis-Iran missiles brings war to Gulf doorstep; hardens support for US‚ÄìIsrael campaign
content_original: By Samia Nakhoul DUBAI, Feb 28 (Reuters) - Thunderous blasts and towering fireballs from Iranian missiles streaking across Gulf states vindicated their leaders' long-held fears that Tehran can bring war to their doorstep, likely to harden Arab rulers' support for U.S.‚ÄìIsraeli strikes.
title_en: Iranian missiles bring war to Gulf states' doorstep, likely hardening support for US-Israel campaign
summary_en: Iran launched missiles targeting Gulf states, causing explosions and fires, which has heightened fears among Arab leaders and is expected to strengthen their support for US and Israeli military actions against Iran. This development underscores the regional impact of the ongoing conflict and the potential for increased Arab involvement in support of US-led efforts.

classification.brief: Iran's ballistic missile strikes on Gulf states escalate regional tensions and solidify support for US-Israeli military actions against Iran.

title_original: Dubai hotel fire appears to be caused by Iranian strike; injuries reported
content_original: Four people were injured in a hotel fire in Palm Jumeirah area of Dubai after a loud explosion was reportedly heard as the Iranian regime launched retaliatory strikes in the Middle East. The Dubai Media Office, a government entity, said in a statement Saturday that the site was secured and the fire had been contained. "The safety and wellbeing of residents and visitors remain the highest priority. Authorities continue to take all necessary measures to safeguard the public. The public is urged to remain calm, rely solely on verified information from official sources, and refrain from circulating videos or images on social media," the media office wrote on X . Dubai authorities confirmed that "an incident" occurred in a building in the Palm Jumeirah area and emergency response teams responded, although they did not elaborate on what caused the incident. title_original: Longtime Trump critic George Conway suggests US is 'terrorist state' after Iran strikes

title_original: Israel's largest ever military flyover hammers Iranian military targets
content_original: Israel pummeled Iranian targets with simultaneous airstrikes from roughly 200 fighter jets in what the Israeli military dubbed its largest ever military flyover in its history. The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) on Saturday published video of its airstrike on missile launchers in western Iran as Israel and the U.S. take part in a joint effort against Tehran. The IDF said the fighter jets flew under the direction of IDF intelligence and the Israeli Air Force and executed an "extensive attack" against the Iranian regime's missile and defense systems in western and central Iran. "This is the largest military flyover in the history of the Israeli Air Force (IAF), conducted following accurate planning and based on high-quality intelligence, while synchronizing hundreds of fighter jets at the same time," the IDF said. title_original: Gulf states on frontlines of Israel-US war on Iran
content_original: Iran launched missile and drone strikes across multiple Arab states hosting US military bases on Saturday, hours after coordinated US-Israeli attacks on Iranian territory . The strikes threaten to widen the conflict to involve at least six countries across the Gulf and Levant , most of whom have long feared they would be on the front lines of any regional war. Air defences were activated in Qatar, the UAE, Bahrain, Kuwait, Jordan, Iraq and Saudi Arabia as Iranian projectiles targeted US-linked military infrastructure across the region. At least one civilian was killed in Abu Dhabi when debris from intercepted missiles struck a residential area, according to Emirati authorities. The escalation followed large-scale unprovoked US and Israeli strikes on Iranian military and strategic targets earlier in the day, including in and around Tehran. US President Donald Trump described the campaign as "massive and ongoing combat operations" aimed at countering Iranian threats. Israeli officials fr...

The escalation threatens to widen the conflict, involving at least six countries in the Gulf and Levant. The activation of air defenses and the death of at least one civilian in Abu Dhabi highlight the direct impact on regional stability and civilian populations.

The attack came as Iran carried out retaliatory strikes in the oil-rich Gulf following US and Israeli attacks -- rattling a region long seen as a haven of peace and security. One of the witnesses said he saw thick black smoke rising from a hotel on the Palm and heard ambulances rushing towards the scene.

title_original: Khamenei targeted, IRGC commander and defence chief 'killed'
content_original: Th e joint Israeli-US strikes on Iran on Saturday targeted Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and President Masoud Pezeshkian in the first wave of attacks, Israel's public broadcaster reported, with questions over their fate. "Iranian Supreme Leader Khamenei and President Masoud Pezeshkian were among the targets of the attack," Kan reported on its X account, citing an Israeli source. A journalist on air also mentioned Ali Shamkhani, adviser to the supreme leader and former defence minister, while noting that he did not know whether the objectives of the strikes had been achieved. "In our opening salvo, we went after targets that are high-profile, people involved in the plans to destroy Israel," an Israeli security source told journalists, speaking on condition of anonymity. An official had told Reuters that Khamenei is not in Tehran and has been transferred to a secure location. content_original: Israel‚Äôs military said its air defense systems intercepted several missiles over Jerusalem on Saturday, following reports of a retaliatory strike from Iran, Anadolu reports. Earlier Saturday, Israel launched the “preemptive” attack under the name ‚ÄòLion‚Äôs Roar,‚Äô declaring a ‚Äúspecial and immediate‚Äù state of emergency across the country. title_en: Iran launches ballistic missile barrage at Israel
summary_en: Iran's IRGC launched ballistic missiles and drones targeting Israel in response to US-Israeli aggression against Iran. Air raid sirens sounded across Israeli cities, with reports of explosions in Haifa and the Galilee region. This escalation signifies a significant expansion of the conflict with potential regional implications.

classification.brief: Iran's ballistic missile barrage against Israel marks a critical escalation, directly involving Iran in the conflict and posing significant regional security risks.

title_original: Lebanon refuses to be drawn into Iran conflict: PM
content_original: Lebanese Prime Minister Nawaf Salam said Saturday that his country refused to be dragged into war, after Israel and the United States launched strikes against Iran. Authorities fear the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group Hezbollah could become involved in the conflict, which saw the US and Israel bomb Iran on Saturday and Tehran respond with missile attacks. Just before the operation began, Israel announced it was carrying out strikes on Hezbollah infrastructure in south Lebanon.
title_en: Lebanon refuses to be drawn into Iran conflict: PM
summary_en: Lebanese Prime Minister Nawaf Salam stated that Lebanon will not be drawn into the ongoing conflict after US and Israeli strikes on Iran, amid concerns that Hezbollah might get involved. Israel preemptively struck Hezbollah infrastructure in south Lebanon before the operation began. This highlights Lebanon's efforts to avoid escalation and the potential for regional spillover as the conflict intensifies.

classification.brief: Israel's preemptive strikes on Hezbollah infrastructure in Lebanon signal potential escalation risks as Lebanon seeks to avoid involvement in the broader Iran conflict.

title_en: Israel Under Wide-Ranging Attack from Iran After Missile Barrage
summary_en: Iran launched a widespread missile attack on Israel, triggering nationwide air raid sirens and prompting the Home Front Command to urge citizens to follow safety protocols. This represents a significant escalation in the ongoing conflict between Iran and Israel, with potential regional implications.

classification.brief: Iran's ballistic missile attack on Israel marks a critical escalation, posing a direct threat to regional stability and potentially drawing in US forces.

title_en: Missile Alerts in Northern Israel Triggered by Suspected Iranian Launch
summary_en: Missile alerts were activated across northern Israel following the detection of missile launches from Iran towards Israeli territory. The Home Front Command urged citizens to follow safety protocols, emphasizing that they save lives. This incident signifies a significant escalation in the ongoing conflict between Israel and Iran, highlighting the direct threat under which Israeli civilians are placed.

classification.brief: Iran's ballistic missile launch towards Israel represents a significant escalation, posing a direct threat to Israeli territory and civilians.

title_en: IDF strikes Hezbollah underground tunnels in southern Lebanon
summary_en: The IDF targeted Hezbollah underground tunnels and launch positions in southern Lebanon, citing their use for 'terror activities.' The military warned that Hezbollah is attempting to rebuild and violating previous understandings, indicating ongoing tensions and potential escalation in the region.

classification.brief: The IDF airstrikes on Hezbollah tunnels in southern Lebanon indicate ongoing tensions and potential escalation in the Israel-Lebanon border region, which could impact the broader Iran‚ÄìUS conflict through Hezbollah's role as an Iranian proxy.

title_original: Israel shuts schools, bans gatherings as Iran launches retaliatory missiles
content_original: By Alexander Cornwell TEL AVIV, Feb 28 (Reuters) - Israel banned public gatherings, shut schools and workplaces and moved hospital patients to underground facilities on Saturday as Tehran launched missiles towards Israel in retaliation for a joint U.S.-Israeli attack on Iran. Defence Minister Israel Katz declared a state of emergency across the country, warning the public of Iranian missile and drone attacks.
title_en: Israel shuts schools, bans gatherings amid Iranian missile retaliation
summary_en: Israel has taken emergency measures, including closing schools and banning gatherings, as Iran launched retaliatory missiles following a joint U.S.-Israeli attack. The country declared a state of emergency, highlighting the threat of Iranian missile and drone attacks. This escalation underscores the ongoing conflict and potential for further regional instability.

classification.brief: Iran's retaliatory missile strikes on Israel following a joint U.S.-Israeli attack signal a significant escalation in regional hostilities and direct engagement between Iran and Israel.

title_en: US and Israel Launch Preventive Attack on Iran: 'Thousands of IRGC Casualties'
summary_en: The US and Israel have initiated a preventive attack on Iran, with Tehran's key centers, including government facilities, targeted. A state of emergency has been declared across Iran. The attack aims to prevent Iran's nuclear capabilities, with President Trump stating the objective is to ensure Iran does not acquire nuclear weapons.

classification.brief: The US and Israel launched a coordinated airstrike on Iran targeting government facilities and IRGC centers, marking a significant escalation in the conflict with mass casualties reported.

title_original: Syrian teen killed in Israeli airstrike in eastern Lebanon
content_original: A Syrian teen was killed and 29 others injured Thursday in Israeli airstrikes in eastern Lebanon despite a ceasefire deal that has been in place since November 2024, Lebanese state media reported, Anadolu reports. The National News Agency (NNA) said a 17-year-old boy was killed in the strike that targeted the Beit Mshik farms area near Kfar Dan in western Baalbek. The fatality came as Israeli warplanes launched a series of airstrikes targeting the western Baalbek area, with fighter jets flying at low altitude above the region. The Israeli army said the strikes targeted infrastructure belonging to the Lebanese group Hezbollah‚Äôs ‚ÄúRadwan Force‚Äù in the Baalbek area. In southern Lebanon, an Israeli drone carried out a strike with a guided […]
title_en: Syrian teen killed in Israeli airstrike in eastern Lebanon
summary_en: An Israeli airstrike in eastern Lebanon killed a Syrian teenager and injured 29 others near Kfar Dan in Baalbek. The strikes targeted Hezbollah's 'Radwan Force' infrastructure in the area, violating the existing ceasefire deal since November 2024. This incident highlights ongoing tensions and potential escalation between Israel and Hezbollah despite the ceasefire.

classification.brief: The Israeli airstrike targeting Hezbollah's 'Radwan Force' infrastructure in Lebanon, despite the ceasefire, signifies ongoing tensions and potential escalation in the region, indirectly impacting the Iran‚ÄìUS conflict through Hezbollah's role as an Iranian proxy.
